synopsis: In episode #11 of the podcast, Devam shares a candid and humorous account of his recent knee injury and the chaotic journey through the healthcare system. He reflects on personal growth, the importance of self-acceptance, and the value of meaningful connections while navigating lifeâ€™s challenges, all delivered with his trademark wit and insight.
quotes: The way you live your life every day is how you end up living your life.
What happened to the room's leg?
You have to give yourself small acts of happiness.
Are you able to feel joy by yourself?
Open your arms if you want to be held.
Cooking isn't that hard; ingredients are just Legos.
You just need to kind of try things together, complementary flavors and textures.
Every relationship ends, but the ability to love and be loved does not.
The biggest thing I'm working on right now is acceptance, accepting multiple truths at the same time.
Loneliness and melancholy are beautiful feelings; sometimes they just point to some need of yours that isn't being met.
